snippet: A simple solar-powered autoclave can effectively steam-sterilize surgical instruments, a study finds, making it a good alternative for rural areas lacking other means.
abstract: Dr Douglas A Schuler study in The American Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene shows that solar stove prototype modified by Rice University team is capable of sterilizing surgical instruments using steam; practicality of stove, which is nearly 12 feet long, remains to be seen in rural African areas where it is most needed.
lead_paragraph: A simple solar-powered autoclave can effectively steam-sterilize surgical instruments, a study finds, making it a good alternative for rural areas lacking other means.
